author: phillip.leblanc
content: In the response for `eth_getBlockByNumber`, will the field for `miner` be empty after the merge?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: No, it will be set to the feeRecipient, the address which collects all transaction fees

author: vinnie9190
content: just seen couple of epochs below 60% on https://goerli.beaconcha.in/ , now is back on finalizing

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Based on bordel.wtf the hash rate would need to spike to 1600TH/s for someone to try to race the bellatrix fork like they did on ropsten, which basically means adding almost another 800TH/s hashrate.  By my estimate that means millions of GPUs, and correct me if I'm wrong but there's still no real economic incentive to do that other than trolling, right?

author: chris2_2_2
content: I can tell you now that isn't happening

author: chris2_2_2
content: That being said I can see 50-100 rejoining if inno fixes its asic a10's that bugged on the 5gb dag since many of them have 6-7 gb.

author: vinnie9190
content: Not gonna happen. Max Nethash recorded was a spike at 1100 Th/s with eth around 3000$ around the beginning of May. Since then, many retails with high power costs  and old gen cards & Asics stopped mining. If someone has the space and capacity to add 800 Th/s to the network (500 MW with the most efficient ASIC), they would have attempt a 51% attack instead of ruining the party for no reason since a TTD override could be implemented if this scenario will appear.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: hah ya really good point about the 51% attack, trolling the TTD would be the least of our worries. ðŸ˜Š

author: vinnie9190
content: yeah, I would like to ask Mario if the Difficoulty bomb has been taken into consideration in the estimation of the TTD, since atm we are around 13.6s/block and I think we might move to the next period (13.9s ???) in the next day or 2.  https://ycharts.com/indicators/ethereum_average_block_time#:~:text=Basic%20Info,4.69%25%20from%20one%20year%20ago.
